gurmukhi: ਤਬ ਦੇਸ ਦੇਸ ਕੇ ਭੂਪ ਅਾਨ ॥ ਕਿਨੌ ਪ੍ਰਣਾਮ ਰਾਜਾ ਮਹਾਨ ॥ ਤਹ ਬੈਠ ਰਾਜ ਸੋਭੰਤ ਅੈਸ ॥ ਜਨ ਦੇਵ ਮੰਡਲੀ ਸਮ ਨ ਤੈਸ ॥੮॥
transliteration: Tab Des Des Ke Bhoop Aan|| Kinau Pranaam Raajaa Mahaan|| Tah Baith Raaj Sobhant Ais|| Jan Dev Mandalisam Na Tais||8||
translation: All the kings of various countries came and bowed before that king Subahu nad sat in the assembly, where their glory excelled that of the assembly of gods.8.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਜੰਤ ਢੋਲ ਦੁੰਦਭ ਅਪਾਰ ॥ ਬਾਜੰਤ ਤੂਰ ਝਨਕੰਤ ਤਾਰ ॥ ਸੋਭਾ ਅਪਾਰ ਬਰਨੀ ਨ ਜਾੲਿ ॥ ਜਨੁ ਬੈਠ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਅਾਭਾ ਬਨਾੲਿ ॥੯॥
transliteration: Baajant Dhol Doundabh Apaar|| Baajant Toor Jhankant Taar|| Sobhaa Apaar Barnina Jaae|| Jan(u) Baith Indra Aabhaa Banaae||9||
translation: The small and big drums were resounding; the glory of that place is indescribable; all of them appeared to be like Indra.9.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਭਾਂਤ ਰਾਜ ਮੰਡਲੀ ਬੈਠ ॥ ਅਵਿਲੋਕਿ ੲਿੰਦ੍ਰ ਜਹ ਨਾਕ ਅੈਠ ॥ ਅਾਭਾ ਅਪਾਰ ਬਰਨੈ ਸੁ ਕੳੁਨ ॥ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਰਹੇ ਜੱਛ ਗੰਧ੍ਰਬ ਮੳੁਨ ॥੧੦॥
transliteration: Eh Bhaant Raaj Mandaleebaith|| Avilok(i) Indra Jah Naak Aith|| Aabhaa Apaar Barnai Su Kaoun|| Hvai Rahe Jachchh Gaddhrab Maoun||10||
translation: That royal assembly was such that seeing it, Indra shrunk his nose, who should describe its glory? The Gandharvas and Yakshas kept silent on seeing it.10.

gurmukhi: ਸੋਭੰਤ ਸੂਰ ॥ ਲੋਭੰਤ ਹੂਰ ॥ ਅਛ੍ਰੀ ਅਪਾਰ ॥ ਰਿੱਝੀ ਸੁਧਾਰ ॥੧੧॥
transliteration: Sobhant Soor|| Lobhant Hoor|| Achhriapaar|| Rijjhisudhaar||11||
translation: The warriors looked splendid, seeing whom the heavenly damsels got allured; there were innumerable heavenly damsels.11.

gurmukhi: ਗਾਵੰਤ ਗੀਤ ॥ ਮੋਹੰਤ ਚੀਤ ॥ ਮਿਲ ਦੇ ਅਸੀਸ ॥ ਜੁਗ ਚਾਰਿ ਜੀਸ ॥੧੨॥
transliteration: Gadvant Geet|| Mohant Cheet|| Mil De Asees|| Joug Cdaar(i) Jees||12||
translation: They were singing fascinating songs, in which they were blessing together for their long like till the end of four ages.12.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਜੰਤ ਤਾਰ ॥ ਡਾਰੈ ਧਮਾਰ ॥ ਦੇਵਾਨ ਨਾਰ ॥ ਪੇਖਤ ਅਪਾਰ ॥੧੩॥
transliteration: Baajant Taar|| Ddarai Dhamaar|| Devaan Naar|| Pekhat Apaar||13||
translation: The knocking on the instruments were being heard and many heavenly damsels were being seen.13.

gurmukhi: ਕੈ ਬੇਦ ਰੀਤ ॥ ਗਾਵੰਤ ਗੀਤ ॥ ਸੋਭਾ ਅਨੂਪ ॥ ਸੋਭੰਤ ਭੂਪ ॥੧੪॥
transliteration: Kai Bed Reet|| Gadvant Deet|| Sobhaa Anoop|| Sobhant Bhoop||14||
translation: The songs were being sung according to Vedic rites and the kings of unique glory looked magnificent.14.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਜੰਤ ਤਾਰ ॥ ਰੀਝੰਤ ਨਾਰ ॥ ਗਾਵੰਤ ਗੀਤ ॥ ਅਾਨੰਦ ਚੀਤ ॥੧੫॥
transliteration: Baajant Taar|| Reejhant Naat|| Gadvant Geet|| Aanand Cheet||15||
translation: The stringed instruments were being played and the women, being pleased, were happily singing songs.15.

gurmukhi: ਗਵਤ ਨਾਰੀ ॥ ਬਾਜਤ ਤਾਰੀ ॥ ਦੇਖਤ ਰਾਜਾ ॥ ਦੇਵਤ ਸਾਜਾ ॥੧੬॥
transliteration: Gadvat Ndaree|| Baajat Tdaree|| Dekhat Raajaa|| Devat Saajaa||16||
translation: The women were singing with the clapping of their hands and the kings with the decoration of gods, were looking at them.16.

gurmukhi: ਗਾਵਤ ਗੀਤੰ ॥ ਅਾਨੰਦ ਚੀਤੰ ॥ ਸੋਭਤ ਸੋਭਾ ॥ ਲੋਭਤ ਲੋਭਾ ॥੧੭॥
transliteration: Gadvat Geetan|| Aanand Cheetan|| Sobhat Sobhaa|| Lobhat Lobhaa||17||
translation: The singing of songs continued with happy mind and seeing the glory of that place, even the mind of greed was becoming greedy.17.

gurmukhi: ਦੋਖਤ ਨੈਣੰ ॥ ਭਾਖਤ ਬੈਣੰ ॥ ਸੋਹਤ ਛਤ੍ਰੀ ॥ ਲੋਭਤ ਅਤ੍ਰੀ ॥੧੮॥
transliteration: Dekhat Nainan|| Bhaakhat Bainan|| Sohat Chhatree|| Lobhat Atree||18||
translation: They were talking with the signs of their eyes and all the weapon wielders were looking splendid.18.

gurmukhi: ਗੱਜਤ ਹਾਥੀ ॥ ਸੱਜਤ ਸਾਥੀ ॥ ਕੂਦਤ ਬਾਜੀ ॥ ਨਾਚਤ ਤਾਜੀ ॥੧੯॥
transliteration: Gadjat Haathee|| Sajjat Saathee|| Koodat Baajee|| Naachat Taajee||19||
translation: The elephants were thundering and the companions were bedecked; the horses were jumping and dancing.19.
